column1: Questions
column10: Answer 1
column12: Answer 2
column14: Answer 3

column1: You can secure data at the organization level, using all of these methods, except __________.
column10: Limit Login IP addresses
column12: Limit Login Hours
column14: Set password policies

column1: Which of these is not a method for controlling record-level access?
column10: Organization-Wide Defaults
column12: Role Hierarchy
column14: Profiles

column1: How can you control object level access? (Choose two.)
column10: Profiles
column12: Permission Sets
column14: Roles

column1: Where can a Standard Lightning Component be placed in the Lightning app builder tool?
column10: Canvas
column12: Console Layout
column14: Mini Page Layout

column1: Universal Container's app builder needs to display an account's rating on all contacts related to that account.Which formula is valid in a text formula field on the contact to display the appropriate value? (Choose two.)
column10: CASE(Account.Rating, Hot, Hot, Warm, Warm, Cold, Cold, Not Rated)
column12: CASE(Account.Rating, "Hot", "Hot", "Warm", "Warm", "Cold", "Cold", "Not Rated")
column14: Account.Rating

column1: Universal Containers has limited in-house development resources, but would like to support online payment processing for its products.What is the recommended solution to meet this requirement?
column10: Configure price books, products, and payment schedules to enable this capability.
column12: Work with developers to develop custom code for payment processing.
column14: Configure Outbound Messaging to send a message to an external Payment Gateway.
column16: Install an AppExchange product to provide Payment Gateway processing.

column1: Universal Containers needs to create a roll-up summary field on a custom object that counts the number of related records on another custom object.What type of field must exist before the roll-up summary can be created, and where should it be located?
column10: A lookup relationship field on the parent object.
column12: A lookup relationship field on the child object.
column14: A master-detail relationship field on the parent object.
column16: A master-detail relationship field on the child object.

column1: Universal Containers needs to set the record type for a converted lead's Account, Contact, and Opportunity based on the user who is converting the lead.How can this be accomplished?
column10: Set the default record types for each Profile for Account, Contact, and Opportunity to the desired record type for converted records.
column12: Set the default record types for each Role for Account, Contact, and Opportunity to the desired record type for converted records.
column14: Set the master record types for each Profile for Account, Contact, and Opportunity to the desired record type for converted records.
column16: Set the master record types for each Role for Account, Contact, and Opportunity to the desired record type for converted records.

column1: Which of these statements is true for Lightning Connect?
column10: No external data is imported into your Salesforce org.
column12: External data is read in real time when you request it.
column14: It can be used with any data source that supports OData 2.0.

column1: Which of these is NOT an appropriate use case for Lightning Connect?
column10: You want to integrate external data without writing custom code.
column12: The external data is changing frequently.
column14: You need to setup workflows and triggers for the external data.
column16: You only need real-time access to a small fraction of the external data.

column1: In which of these scenarios is ETL a better choice than Lightning Connect? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: You need to create or update the external data in addition to reading it.
column12: You need the external data to follow the sharing rules defined for your organization.
column14: You want to generate reports and charts from the external data.

column1: Which of these is NOT true about external objects?
column10: They integrate with Salesforce APIs, Apex, Visualforce, and Chatter.
column12: They can be related to other objects.
column14: You can use them in formula fields.
column16: They are automatically viewable in the Salesforce Mobile App.

column1: Users can get Salesforce in all of the following ways except __________.
column10: As a mobile browser app that runs in supported browsers.
column12: As a downloadable app from Google Play.
column14: As a downloadable app from www.salesforce.com
column16: As a downloadable app from the Apple App Store.

column1: The Salesforce user interface includes all of these key elements except __________.
column10: Feed
column12: Action Bar
column14: Navigation Menu

column1: When should you refresh a sandbox?
column10: 3 Hours before you need it.
column12: When you are finished with the current sandbox.
column14: 10 Days after an implementation.

column1: What is true about dashboard filters? (Choose three.)
column10: Filters can be added to dashboards that contain Visualforce components.
column12: It's not possible to filter on bucket fields.
column14: Filters aren't applied when you schedule or e-mail a dashboard.
column16: You can't filter data on a joined report in dashboard view or add a filter to a dashboard that only has joined reports.

column1: A manager wants to embed charts into his accounts object in one-page layout.How many charts can you embed for him?
What are the two types of packages? (Choose two.)
column10: Unmanaged
column12: Named
column14: Managed

column1: What should you do when a user requests a report?
column10: Ask follow-up questions, to get all the requirements.
column12: Document the user's requirements.
column14: Map the user's requirements to report criteria.

column1: You can control access to report folders based on __________.
column10: Permissions, roles, and public groups.
column12: Public groups, organization-wide defaults, and IP restrictions.
column14: Password settings, permissions, and user settings.

column1: When you specify a single running user of a dashboard, that user __________.
column10: Is the only one who can post a snapshot of the dashboard to Chatter.
column12: Determines which data is displayed on the dashboard, due to the user's security settings.
column14: Must be the same person who created the report.
column16: Must have the "View All Data" permission.

column1: DRAG DROP -In what order does Salesforce process rules?Match the rules from the left column with their appropriate order in the right column.Select and Place:
All of the following are advantages of the Schema Builder except __________.
column10: All object and field relationship details are available from one screen.
column12: You can view fields and relationships for custom, but not standard objects.
column14: Schema Builder shows details like field values, required fields, and how objects are related.
column16: It's easy to build objects and fields directly from the Schema Builder, allowing you to visualize and change relationships with ease.

column1: What should be done to create a custom object from the Schema Builder?
column10: From the Objects tab, select New>Object.
column12: From the Elements tab, drag Object onto the canvas.
column14: Right-click in the canvas and select "New Object".

column1: What should be done to create a custom field from the Schema Builder?
column10: From the Objects tab, select New>Field.
column12: From the Elements tab, drag a field type onto the canvas.
column14: In the canvas, right-click an object and select "New Field".

column1: To leverage flows you need to __________.
column10: Have Run Flows permission enabled.
column12: Have access to the Visualforce page the flow uses.
column14: The flow must be active.

column1: Which three statements are true about Master-Detail relationships? (Choose three.)
column10: You can't convert it if there is a roll-up summary field.
column12: Converting a look-up to master detail changes the OWD to Controlled by Parent.
column14: A look-up can be converted to a master detail if there are existing records with null values.
column16: SF displays a waiting page after you request to change a master detail to a look-up or vice versa.

column1: What happens when you convert a picklist to a multi-select picklist? (Choose two.)
column10: Values are retained.
column12: Values not in the picklist are deleted from existing records when the data type changes.
column14: Data is lost.
column16: You can't convert to a multi-select picklist.

column1: If data is lost, any list view based on the custom field will be deleted, and assignment and escalation rules may be affected.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: You can convert a Text Area(Long) to E-mail, Phone, Text, Text Area or URL without data loss. (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: True
column12: False

column1: You cannot change auto number to text and vice versa and not lose your data.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: You can have multiple records with the same external ID.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What is true about a master detail relationship? (Choose three.)
column10: To create multilevel master-detail relationships, you need the "Customize Application" user permission.
column12: Standard objects can't be on the detail side of a custom object in a master-detail relationship.
column14: You can create a master-detail relationship if the custom object already contains data.
column16: You can create a relationship as a lookup and then convert it to master-detail if the lookup field in all records contains a value.
column18: By default, records can be reparented master-detail relationships.

column1: What is true about Junction objects?
column10: Junction object records are deleted when either associated master record is deleted and placed in the Recycle Bin.
column12: If both associated master records are deleted, the junction object record is deleted permanently and can't be restored.
column14: The first master-detail relationship you create on your junction object becomes the primary relationship.

column1: What type of relationships can you create on External Objects? (Choose all that apply.)
column10: Lookup
column12: External lookup
column14: Indirect lookup

column1: Indirect lookup relationship fields can be created on external objects only.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What is true about external lookup relationship fields? (Choose all that apply.)
column10: Lookup filters are available for external lookup relationship fields.
column12: Cascade-delete isn't available for external object relationships.
column14: Only objects that have a custom field with the External ID and Unique attributes are available as parent objects in indirect lookup relationships.

column1: Each workflow rule applies to a single object.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What is true for all custom and some standard objects?
column10: You can create workflow and approval actions where a change to a detail record updates a field on the related master record.
column12: Cross-object field updates work for custom-to-custom master-detail relationships, custom-to-standard master-detail relationships.
column14: Cross-object field updates work for a few standard-to-standard master-detail relationships.

column1: Workflow rules on custom objects are NOT automatically deleted if the custom object is deleted.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What order does SF process rules?
column10: Validation rules, assignment rules, workflow rules, auto-response rules, escalation rules.
column12: Validation rules, assignment rules, auto-response rules, workflow rules, escalation rules.
column14: Escalation rules, Validation rules, assignment rules, auto-response rules, workflow rules.
column16: Auto-response rules, Validation rules, assignment rules, workflow rules, escalation rules.

column1: What is true about Workflow rules? (Choose all that apply.)
column10: Saving or creating records can trigger more than one rule.
column12: Workflow rules only trigger on converted leads if validation and triggers for lead convert are enabled in your organization.
column14: Workflow rules trigger automatically and are visible to the user.
column16: Workflow rules can't be triggered by campaign statistic fields, including individual campaign statistics and campaign hierarchy statistics.

column1: What are the limitations of workflow rules?
column10: You can't create e-mail alerts for workflow rules on activities.
column12: You can't package workflow rules with time triggers.
column14: You can't create outbound messages for workflow rules on junction objects.

column1: What is true about validation rules? (Choose all that apply.)
column10: When one validation rule fails, Salesforce continues to check any additional validation rules on that field or any other field on the page and displays all appropriate error messages at once.
column12: Campaign hierarchies follow validation rules.
column14: Validation rules are only enforced during lead conversion if "validation and triggers for lead conversion" are enabled in your organization.
column16: Salesforce runs validation rules before creating records submitted via Web-to-Lead and Web-to-Case, and only creates records that have valid values.

column1: You should use a lookup filter if __________. (Choose two.)
column10: You want to improve user efficiency by limiting the number of available options in a lookup search dialog.
column12: You are close to the maximum number of lookup filters allowed.
column14: You want to improve user efficiency by automating filters on lookup search dialogs that your users manually set.
column16: You must implement a complex business rule that requires you to use a formula. Formulas can reference fields that basic filter criteria can't reference, such as fields on the parent of the source object. Formulas can also use functions. For example, use ISNEW if the rule should only apply on record creation, or ISCHANGED if the rule should apply when a field changes.

column1: You should use a Validation rule if __________. (Choose two.)
column10: You want to improve user efficiency by limiting the number of available options in a lookup search dialog.
column12: You are close to the maximum number of lookup filters allowed.
column14: You want to improve user efficiency by automating filters on lookup search dialogs that your users manually set.
column16: You must implement a complex business rule that requires you to use a formula. Formulas can reference fields that basic filter criteria can't reference, such as fields on the parent of the source object. Formulas can also use functions. For example, use ISNEW if the rule should only apply on record creation, or ISCHANGED if the rule should apply when a field changes.

column1: What type of sandbox should you use for full performance and load testing?
column10: Developer
column12: Partial Copy
column14: Full Sandbox

column1: What sandbox should you use for data load and integration testing? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: Developer
column12: Partial Copy
column14: Full Sandbox

column1: What sandbox is used for virtually any development, testing, or training purpose? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: Developer
column12: Partial Copy
column14: Full Sandbox

column1: The sandbox copy engine creates an organization as part of each creation and refresh request. So, the organization ID of your sandbox changes each time your sandbox is refreshed.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What happens to user information when a sandbox is created? (Choose two.)
column10: The sandbox name is appended to the username.
column12: If the resulting username is not unique, a second modification is performed in which some characters and digits are prepended to the modified username.
column14: User e-mail addresses are NOT modified in your sandbox so that production users don't receive automatically generated e-mail messages from the sandbox.

column1: New and refreshed sandboxes have the default e-mail deliverability setting System e-mail only.What are the other options? (Choose three.)
column10: No access
column12: System e-mail only
column14: All access

column1: What is true about unmanaged packages?
column10: Once the components are installed from an unmanaged package, the components can be edited in the organization they are installed in.
column12: The developer who created and uploaded the unmanaged package has no control over the installed components, and can't change or upgrade them.
column14: Unmanaged packages should not be used to migrate components from a sandbox to production organization. Instead, use Change Sets.

column1: What is true about change sets? (Choose two.)
column10: Change sets can only contain modifications you can make through the Setup menu.
column12: They contain data such as records.
column14: Change sets can only be sent between organizations that are affiliated with a production organization.

column1: What are use cases for Validation Rules?
column10: Enforce conditionally required fields
column12: Enforce proper data format
column14: Enforce consistency

column1: What are the steps for creating a dynamic approval process?
column10: Create (user) lookup fields on the object being approved, Create a custom object as an approval matrix, Populate the approval matrix record, Create Apex code to populate the user fields from the approval matrix record, Create or update an approval process to utilize the new lookup fields.
column12: Create standard object as an approval matrix.
column14: Create an approval process.

column1: For an external object relationship, you can create a lookup relationship.What type of object(s) can be the parent?
column10: External
column12: Standard or Custom
column14: Standard or External

column1: For an external object relationship, you can create an indirect lookup relationship.What type of object(s) can be the parent?
column10: External
column12: Standard or Custom
column14: Standard or External

column1: A Lightning component is a compact, configurable, and reusable element that you can drag and drop onto a Lightning Page in the Lightning app builder.
column10: True
column12: False

column1: What are the standard Lightning components?
column10: Filter List
column12: Recent Items
column14: Report Chart
